Currently, there is no effective drug against COVID-19. One of the treatment alternatives used is lopinavir/ritonavir (LPV/r), which showed in vitro activity and positive clinical outcomes against coronaviruses in previous epidemics (SARS and MERS).
2 A recent study in a severe COVID-19 patient showed no clinical benefit from delayed initiation of LPV/r, so further adequately conducted studies are needed to establish the usefulness of LPV/r.
